page.title: 18PICTOR HALL FARM
page.content: Pictor hall was built in 1750.The farmer, Wendy Fearn has lived there for 22 years. It is a{STOCK FARM:DAIRY {AND BEEF CATTLE.}They have casual labours, but nobody permanent. They do any odd jobs that need doing. The farm covers 100 acres. The machines are three tractors,a muckspreader and a bailer. Pictor Hall used to be a small cottage, and gradually the number of buildings increased.Behind the farm are stables, formerly used for{breeding cavalry {horses,}but now for cows. In winter more problems occur because of snow. But work finishes early because of the {dark.In summer, the working day is {from 6am _11pm. { The hall and farm are both listed {buildings.}At the moment they are in the middle of building a slurry tank.
